{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3531154,"name":"Muhilan Krishnan","username":"Hello-There","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/h/b782af/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-18T04:19:00.739Z","cooked":"

MAXSwerve Covers - Team 8429

Hey FRC Community!

We have been developing covers for our MAXSwerve and are excited to reveal them to the community! Through the 2024 Season, Crescendo we found that random debris, dust, and assorted foreign objects made their way into our swerve. The covers we used at the time didn’t block enough of the dust and weren’t extensive enough for our needs. Additionally these covers required us to disassemble the module to take them off, making them slow and cumbersome to take off in pits.

The Solution

We decided to design our own covers, to meet our criteria!

  • Fast and easy assembly + disassembly
  • Modular and adaptable
  • Able to incorporate team branding

Our final covers took inspiration from the Spectrum Dust Covers, and the 2056 MK4i Covers found online.

image805×1068 115 KB

Snap on Covers

We decided to create a cover that encases the outer part of the MAXSwerve to guard against dust, and have a good place to display our team number! These covers have a snap fit that has worked well for us when printed on a Bambu P1S. Depending on your printer and settings, these tolerances may need to be adjusted.

image1108×747 50.8 KB

Motor Cover

The Motor Covers were designed to fit over the drive and steering motors on MAXSwerve. These are designed for wiring to pass through as normal while covering up the motors and providing a shield on the sides. The large surface area on top provides us ample space to put a team logo on, or even to mount cameras. Through the holes provided on the cover, you can bolt right through the covers, MAXSwerve, and chassis bars.

image1002×661 69 KB

Printing

We used both a Bambu Lab P1S, and Bambu Lab A1 Mini with AMS to print these. Using these printers we were able to do the multicolor with our team logo, and really make those pop. With these printers, we had no problems with tolerance or bad prints. We recommend laying the motor covers upside down to achieve a faster and higher quality print.

image802×734 127 KB

image1003×778 43.1 KB

Onshape Doc

We’d love to hear your feedback and comments!

Muhilan - Team 8429 Valence Robotics

I noticed that the back of module is not covered up at all. Considering how you have a belly pan it probably won’t make much of a difference, but there is space for dust to get in here.

I also noticed that the motor cover uses the 6 bolts that hold the swerve to the frame. This works, but it means to get that cover off, you have to take off all 6 bolts which is annoying and time-consuming. I would recommend instead using these two bolt holes here:

image849×702 63.9 KB

Those holes are entirely unused by any other part of the swerve, and are threaded. It would mean you would have to modify the shape of the cover, but not by much.

These are just suggestions. This is a great design regardless
